jobs.title: Business Intelligence Analyst
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Block Labs

Block Labs is a leading force in the Web3 space, incubating, investing in, and accelerating top-tier fintech, crypto, and iGaming projects. With a mission to shape the future of decentralized technology, we partner with visionary startups to raise funding, refine product-market fit, and grow their audiences.

As we continue to expand, we are looking for an ambitious and self-driven individual to join our rapidly growing team!

About The Role

We’re seeking a data-driven Business Intelligence Analyst to turn blockchain and product data into clear, actionable insights that drive growth, retention, and risk controls across our crypto-enabled iGaming products. You’ll own the end-to-end analytics stack for wallet funnels, wagering behavior, lifecycle marketing, and compliance—using SQL, dbt, Python, Amplitude, and Tableau as your primary tools.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Design, build, and iterate on Tableau dashboards that surface core KPIs (GGR/NGR, ARPU, LTV, churn, deposit→wager conversion, fraud loss rate).

  • Write production-grade SQL (CTEs, window functions, incremental models) to model clean datasets from ClickHouse and on-chain tables.

  • Use Python (pandas, seaborn, scikit-learn, SciPy) for analysis, data quality checks, lightweight ETL/backfills, API integrations (e.g., blockchain providers), and automation.

  • Work with on-chain data: parse EVM logs and token transfers (ERC-20/721), join labeled-address datasets, analyze exchange/bridge flows, gas/fee dynamics, and wallet clustering.

  • Own crypto wallet analytics across the funnel (custodial vs. non-custodial, deposits/withdrawals, conversion to first deposit).

  • Partner with Product, Marketing/CRM, Risk/Compliance, and Engineering to define event schemas and tracking plans; ensure data quality, lineage, and documentation.

  • Design and analyze experiments (A/B and holdouts), cohorts, and attribution within iGaming and regional compliance constraints.

  • Investigate anomalies (bonus abuse, bot usage, arbitrage, suspicious wallet rings) and recommend mitigations.

  • Automate recurring reporting and alerting for KPI movements.

Qualifications

  • Experience: Minimum 2 years in Business Intelligence or Data Analytics; prior exposure to crypto or iGaming strongly preferred.

  • Ownership & Impact: Demonstrated ability to build robust analytics infrastructure and scalable self-serve data products.

  • SQL: Advanced proficiency with complex joins, window functions, performance optimization, and dimensional data modeling.

  • Tableau: Expert use of LOD expressions, parameters, actions, data modeling, extract vs. live strategies, and dashboard performance tuning.

  • dbt: Hands-on experience with environments, sources/exposures, testing, documentation, and CI/CD integration.

  • Python: Proficient in analytics and data engineering (e.g., pandas); capable of writing modular, maintainable code, integrating with APIs, and scheduling lightweight jobs.

  • Crypto Domain: Practical understanding of crypto wallets and transaction flows, including custodial vs. non-custodial models and WalletConnect/MetaMask.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience with dbt Cloud, data quality tooling (Great Expectations, Monte Carlo), and workflow orchestration (Airflow, Prefect).

  • Demonstrated ability to perform on-chain analytics using platforms such as Dune, Flipside, Goldsky, or Nansen, or via self-indexed data; familiarity with contract ABIs and entity/address labeling.

  • Hands-on experience with modern data warehouses and object storage, including ClickHouse, AWS, and Amazon S3.

  • Working knowledge of data governance and privacy standards (e.g., GDPR), including data minimization and retention policies.

  • Strong understanding of iGaming economics and KPIs: deposits, wagers, hold, GGR/NGR, RTP, bonus efficiency, responsible gaming metrics, and common fraud/AML patterns.

  • Familiarity with product analytics platforms (Amplitude, Mixpanel, Google Analytics).

What kind of culture can I expect?
Mature, mission-driven, and low-ego. We value clarity over noise, outcomes over theatrics, and pace without chaos. If you’re one of the smartest minds in your craft and want to build with other experts, you’ll feel at home here.

jobs.title: VIP Manager, Korean Markets (Crypto Casino)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Block Labs

Block Labs is a leading force in the Web3 space, incubating, investing in, and accelerating top-tier fintech, crypto, and iGaming projects. With a mission to shape the future of decentralized technology, we partner with visionary startups to raise funding, refine product-market fit, and grow their audiences.

As we continue to expand, we are looking for an ambitious and self-driven individual to join our rapidly growing team!

The Opportunity

We are looking for a passionate and experienced VIP Manager to lead our high-value customer engagement efforts for the Korean market. You will play a critical role in maintaining long-term relationships with our most loyal players and growing our footprint in Korea. This position requires native-level Korean fluency, deep cultural understanding of Korean customer expectations, and strong operational capabilities.

As a brand rooted in innovation and entertainment, we are building a premium VIP experience that reflects Korean values of respect, discretion, and trust.

Your Responsibilities:

VIP Relationship Management

  • Develop strong, trust-based relationships with Korean high-value players through tailored communication and service.

  • Ensure a white-glove experience that reflects high standards of Korean culture.

Customer Engagement & Retention

  • Personalize interactions and campaigns based on player preferences, behavior, and lifecycle status.

  • Organize exclusive events, promotions, and offers targeted to VIP interests, both online and offline (e.g., tournaments, gifts, concierge perks).

Operations & Support

  • Serve as the main point of contact for VIPs in Korea, addressing all inquiries with speed and professionalism.

  • Handle escalations, disputes, and feedback with care and attention to detail.

Monitoring & Insights

  • Track player activity to identify upsell and retention opportunities.

  • Analyze data and produce reports on VIP KPIs, campaign effectiveness, and player satisfaction.

Collaboration & Strategy

  • Partner with CRM, product, marketing, and compliance teams to localize strategies for the Korean audience.

  • Provide market intelligence and feedback to optimize our VIP offering in Korea.

What We’re Looking For:

  • Native-level Korean (spoken and written) and strong English communication.

  • Proven success in a VIP or high-touch customer-facing role in online gaming, iGaming, entertainment, or luxury services.

  • Deep understanding of Korean player behavior, preferences, and cultural nuances.

  • Experience with data tools (CRM, analytics platforms, segmentation engines).

  • Highly organized, detail-oriented, and emotionally intelligent.

  • Knowledge of Korea’s regulatory landscape for iGaming is a strong plus.

  • Flexible schedule to accommodate player needs, including evenings and weekends when necessary.

What kind of culture can I expect?
Mature, mission-driven, and low-ego. We value clarity over noise, outcomes over theatrics, and pace without chaos. If you’re one of the smartest minds in your craft and want to build with other experts, you’ll feel at home here.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer - Go
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Block Labs

Block Labs is a leading force in the Web3 space, incubating, investing in, and accelerating top-tier fintech, crypto, and iGaming projects. With a mission to shape the future of decentralized technology, we partner with visionary startups to raise funding, refine product-market fit, and grow their audiences.

As we continue to expand, we are looking for an ambitious and self-driven individual to join our rapidly growing team!

About The Role

We are developing a multi-tenant Cashier-as-a-Service platform, purpose-built for crypto. This platform provides a unified backend for managing deposits, withdrawals, balances, and settlements across multiple tenants, from exchanges and payment providers to decentralized apps.

You’ll be joining a senior, highly technical team building greenfield backend services at the core of a secure, high-throughput financial platform. We value autonomy, craftsmanship, and long-term thinking, and we’re building systems designed for resilience, transparency, and scale.

Key Responsibilities:

· Design and build distributed backend services that power a multi-tenant cashier and transaction management system.

· Develop core platform features for wallet orchestration, payment routing, reconciliation, and tenant onboarding.

· Integrate with blockchain networks, payment gateways, and third-party crypto APIs.

· Collaborate with product, frontend, and infrastructure teams to deliver reliable, end-to-end systems.

· Contribute to architectural design and drive technical decisions across services.

· Ensure scalability, fault-tolerance, and compliance within a regulated financial context.

· Maintain clean, testable, and well-documented Go code following industry best practices.

About You:

· 6+ years of experience in backend development, ideally in high-throughput or financial systems.

· Strong proficiency in Go as a primary backend language; experience with gRPC and RESTful APIs is highly valued.

· Solid understanding of distributed systems, multi-tenant architectures, and microservices.

· Experience with blockchain integrations, crypto custody, or payment rails is a strong advantage.

· Comfortable working in cloud-native environments.

· Deep commitment to software reliability, observability, and security best practices.

· Excellent communication skills and a collaborative mindset.

Nice to Have:

· Experience with cryptographic key management, wallet abstractions, or transaction signing flows.

· Background in fintech, DeFi, or crypto exchange infrastructure.

· Familiarity with event-driven systems, Kafka, or message queues.

· Prior experience designing APIs for multi-tenant or white-label products.

What kind of culture can I expect?
Mature, mission-driven, and low-ego. We value clarity over noise, outcomes over theatrics, and pace without chaos. If you’re one of the smartest minds in your craft and want to build with other experts, you’ll feel at home here.

jobs.title: QA Engineer, iGaming
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Block Labs

Block Labs is a leading force in the Web3 space, incubating, investing in, and accelerating top-tier fintech, crypto, and iGaming projects. With a mission to shape the future of decentralized technology, we partner with visionary startups to raise funding, refine product-market fit, and grow their audiences.

As we continue to expand, we are looking for an ambitious and self-driven individual to join our rapidly growing team!

About The Role

Are you ready to champion quality in a dynamic, cross-functional environment? We’re looking for a Quality Assurance Engineer who excels at manual testing and is eager to grow into automation down the line. In this role, you’ll collaborate with product and development teams to ensure a reliable, high-quality platform experience. You’ll also help lay the groundwork for new testing tools, frameworks, and processes as our platform continues to expand.

Key Responsibilities:

● Conduct thorough manual testing across mobile, desktop, and web platforms, ensuring seamless user experiences.

● Collaborate with product managers and developers to align on testing objectives, proactively identify potential issues, and deliver customer-focused features on schedule.

● Assist in formulating basic automation strategies, setting up foundational testing frameworks, and gradually expanding automation efforts.

● Prepare clear test cases, track defects, and document findings to support continuous improvement and transparency across teams.

● Help define and refine QA processes to boost product quality and streamline the testing cycle.

About You:

● You have solid experience in manual testing and an understanding of how to contribute to good QA practices.

● You are comfortable testing across web, mobile, and desktop and adapting to changing requirements.

● You have a keen eye for detail and can uncover edge cases, providing valuable feedback to development teams.

● Familiarity with QA tools such as TestRail, Testmo and BrowserStack is also an advantage.

● You are motivated to learn about test automation and embrace opportunities to develop those skills in the future. Knowledge in automation/typescript is a plus.

● You communicate effectively, working well with cross-functional teams to share updates, insights, and best practices.

● iGaming experience is a must; blockchain experience is a plus.

What kind of culture can I expect?
Mature, mission-driven, and low-ego. We value clarity over noise, outcomes over theatrics, and pace without chaos. If you’re one of the smartest minds in your craft and want to build with other experts, you’ll feel at home here.

jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Block Labs

Block Labs is a leading force in the Web3 space, incubating, investing in, and accelerating top-tier fintech, crypto, and iGaming projects. With a mission to shape the future of decentralized technology, we partner with visionary startups to raise funding, refine product-market fit, and grow their audiences.

As we continue to expand, we are looking for an ambitious and self-driven individual to join our rapidly growing team!

About The Role

As a Platform Engineer, you will design, implement, and maintain a highly scalable, secure, and automated platform on AWS. Collaborating with cross-functional teams, you will ensure the platform supports efficient application delivery and aligns with business objectives. This role focuses on the continuous improvement of our cloud infrastructure and operations.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Build and maintain a secure, resilient, and scalable AWS platform to support business-critical applications.

  • Implement and manage CI/CD pipelines, infrastructure-as-code (IaC), and automation frameworks to enhance efficiency and reliability.

  • Collaborate with developers, QA, and product teams to align platform capabilities with business requirements.

  • Ensure the platform meets the highest security standards while optimizing performance, scalability, and cost-effectiveness across all infrastructure.

  • Support migrations from other platforms to AWS, ensuring seamless transitions and minimal downtime.

  • Monitor and troubleshoot platform performance issues, identifying opportunities for improvement.

  • Research and implement new AWS services and emerging technologies to enhance platform capabilities.

  • Participate in on-call rotation and incident resolution to ensure platform reliability and uptime.

About You:

  • You have 3+ years of experience in cloud engineering or platform engineering roles, with a strong focus on AWS.

  • You have hands-on experience with Infrastructure-as-Code tools like Terraform or CloudFormation.

  • You have a strong command of both spoken and written English.

  • A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field is an advantage.

  • Experience in fintech, DeFi, or iGaming is a nice-to-have.

jobs.title: Senior Web Designer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Block Labs

Block Labs is a leading force in the Web3 space, incubating, investing in, and accelerating top-tier fintech, crypto, and iGaming projects. With a mission to shape the future of decentralized technology, we partner with visionary startups to raise funding, refine product-market fit, and grow their audiences.

As we continue to expand, we are looking for an ambitious and self-driven individual to join our rapidly growing team!

The Role

We’re hiring a Senior Web Designer to craft high-converting, brand-consistent websites and landing pages. You’ll design for clarity, usability, and performance and you’ll structure your work so it translates cleanly into WordPress Gutenberg blocks & patterns. Engineering handles development; your job is to deliver a systemized design that’s ready to build.

Key Responsibilities

  • Design and deliver high-impact web experiences — including homepages, landing pages, onboarding flows, and educational pages — with a focus on usability, engagement, and measurable outcomes (sign-ups, retention, sales).

  • Develop and maintain a scalable design system (style guides, tokens for color/typography/spacing, component libraries, iconography, motion principles) that ensures consistency across brands.

  • Map design components to Gutenberg by defining blocks, patterns, variants, and constraints so development teams can implement your system 1:1.

  • Produce end-to-end design outputs: wireframes → interactive prototypes → polished Figma files with annotations, real or realistic content, and coverage for all breakpoints, states (hover/focus/disabled, error/empty/loading/success), and accessibility considerations.

  • Collaborate closely with product managers, marketers, and developers to align designs with brand identity, strategic goals, and technical feasibility.

  • Leverage data and insights (heatmaps, analytics, A/B tests) to inform design decisions and iterate quickly.

  • Design with performance and accessibility in mind, considering contrast, semantic hierarchy, image optimization, animation budgets, and Core Web Vitals.

  • Support design QA during build to ensure fidelity and quality in final delivery.

  • Stay current with web design and UX trends to keep our brands ahead of the curve.

What we’re looking for

  • Portfolio of websites/landing pages showing conversion-oriented design and strong UX craft.

  • Gutenberg awareness: you think in reusable blocks/patterns, not page-by-page one-offs.

  • Figma expert: components, variants, auto-layout, tokens, library management, and clear annotation.

  • Commercial mindset: you tie design choices to business goals and can explain trade-offs.

  • Collaboration: crisp communication with product, marketing, and engineering; feedback that’s kind and actionable.

  • Detail orientation: pixel-perfect where it matters; pragmatic where it doesn’t.

  • Nice-to-have: experience in crypto/iGaming/fintech, accessibility best practices (WCAG), and performance-aware design.

What kind of culture can I expect?
Mature, mission-driven, and low-ego. We value clarity over noise, outcomes over theatrics, and pace without chaos. If you’re one of the smartest minds in your craft and want to build with other experts, you’ll feel at home here.

As we continue to expand, we are looking for an ambitious and self-driven individual to join our rapidly growing team!


THE ROLE

We’re hiring a Senior Web Designer to craft high-converting, brand-consistent websites and landing pages. You’ll design for clarity, usability, and performance and you’ll structure your work so it translates cleanly into WordPress Gutenberg blocks & patterns. Engineering handles development; your job is to deliver a systemized design that’s ready to build.


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

 - Design and deliver high-impact web experiences — including homepages, landing pages, onboarding flows, and educational pages — with a focus on usability, engagement, and measurable outcomes (sign-ups, retention, sales).

 - Develop and maintain a scalable design system (style guides, tokens for color/typography/spacing, component libraries, iconography, motion principles) that ensures consistency across brands.

 - Map design components to Gutenberg by defining blocks, patterns, variants, and constraints so development teams can implement your system 1:1.

 - Produce end-to-end design outputs: wireframes → interactive prototypes → polished Figma files with annotations, real or realistic content, and coverage for all breakpoints, states (hover/focus/disabled, error/empty/loading/success), and accessibility considerations.

 - Collaborate closely with product managers, marketers, and developers to align designs with brand identity, strategic goals, and technical feasibility.

 - Leverage data and insights (heatmaps, analytics, A/B tests) to inform design decisions and iterate quickly.

 - Design with performance and accessibility in mind, considering contrast, semantic hierarchy, image optimization, animation budgets, and Core Web Vitals.

 - Support design QA during build to ensure fidelity and quality in final delivery.

 - Stay current with web design and UX trends to keep our brands ahead of the curve.


WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR

 - Portfolio of websites/landing pages showing conversion-oriented design and strong UX craft.

 - Gutenberg awareness: you think in reusable blocks/patterns, not page-by-page one-offs.

 - Figma expert: components, variants, auto-layout, tokens, library management, and clear annotation.

 - Commercial mindset: you tie design choices to business goals and can explain trade-offs.

 - Collaboration: crisp communication with product, marketing, and engineering; feedback that’s kind and actionable.

 - Detail orientation: pixel-perfect where it matters; pragmatic where it doesn’t.

 - Nice-to-have: experience in crypto/iGaming/fintech, accessibility best practices (WCAG), and performance-aware design.

What kind of culture can I expect?
Mature, mission-driven, and low-ego. We value clarity over noise, outcomes over theatrics, and pace without chaos. If you’re one of the smartest minds in your craft and want to build with other experts, you’ll feel at home here.

jobs.title: Data Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Block Labs

Block Labs is a leading force in the Web3 space, incubating, investing in, and accelerating top-tier fintech, crypto, and iGaming projects. With a mission to shape the future of decentralized technology, we partner with visionary startups to raise funding, refine product-market fit, and grow their audiences.

As we continue to expand, we are looking for an ambitious and self-driven individual to join our rapidly growing team!

About The Role

We are seeking a highly skilled Data Engineer to lead the design, implementation, and maintenance of our unified analytical data warehouse on ClickHouse. The ideal candidate is experienced in building scalable data pipelines, working with modern orchestration tools, and leveraging AWS services for data storage and processing. You will collaborate closely with data team to ensure data accuracy, reliability, and accessibility.

Key Responsibilities

  • Design, develop, and maintain a unified analytical data warehouse on ClickHouse (DWH) to support business intelligence and advanced analytics.

  • Participation in DWH architecture design

  • Analysis and research of current system functionality

  • Updating documentation based on results

  • Writing automated tests

  • Develop and manage workflows and data orchestration using tools like Apache Airflow.

  • Ensure seamless integration of AWS services (e.g., Redshift, S3, Lambda) and ClickHouse for data storage and transformation.

  • Implement CI/CD pipelines for data workflows to ensure quality and agility in deployments.

  • Monitor, debug, and resolve issues related to data pipelines and systems.

  • Maintain documentation for data infrastructure, processes, and best practices.

Required Skills and Experience:

Technical Expertise:

  • Python: Proficiency in Python for building and optimizing data pipelines.

  • Data Orchestration: Hands-on experience with tools like Apache Airflow

  • CI/CD: Familiarity with CI/CD tools (e.g., GitHub Actions, GitLab CI/CD) for automating data workflows.

  • Data Modeling: Expertise in designing efficient and scalable data models (e.g., star/snowflake schemas).

General Skills:

  • Proven experience in building and maintaining scalable DWH, reliable ETL/ELT pipelines.

  • Strong SQL skills for querying and performance optimization.

  • Ability to work in an agile environment and adapt to evolving priorities.

  • Excellent problem-solving skills with attention to detail.

  • Effective communication and collaboration skills to work with technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Cloud Platforms: experience with AWS services, including but not limited to Redshift, S3, Lambda, and Glue.

  • ClickHouse: Practical experience in working with ClickHouse for data processing and analysis.

  • Experience of building reports in Tableau or Power BI

  • Experience with data governance, quality frameworks, and security best practices.

What kind of culture can I expect?
Mature, mission-driven, and low-ego. We value clarity over noise, outcomes over theatrics, and pace without chaos. If you’re one of the smartest minds in your craft and want to build with other experts, you’ll feel at home here.
